Award.AwardTitle: International Congress of Mathematical Physics 2015; Santiago, Chile; July 27-August 1, 2015
Award.AbstractNarration:
The XVIII International Congress of Mathematical Physics (ICMP2015) will be held in Santiago, Chile, July 27 through August 1, 2015. This award provides support for fifteen U.S.-based junior researchers in mathematical physics to attend the ICMP2015 as well as the Young Researchers Symposium to be held in Santiago, Chile, July 24-25, 2015. The International Congress of Mathematical Physics is one of the most important conferences on Mathematical Physics throughout the world. The International Association of Mathematical Physics (IAMP) hosts the conference, which has been held every three years since 1976. The congress provides a wonderful opportunity for junior investigators at U.S. institutions to engage with internationally renowned researchers in mathematical physics.

Mathematical physics is a field with a long tradition in mathematics. Broadly defined, it focuses on the application of mathematics to problems in physics, as well as the development of mathematical methods suitable for such applications and for the formulation of physical theories. It has connections to practically every field of mathematics, including algebraic geometry, complex analysis, differential geometry, partial differential equations, and stochastic analysis. For more information, please visit the Congress website www.icmp2015.cl

POR.DRECONTENT:
The grant supported the travel of 27 scientists working in US Institutions to the XVIII International Congress of Mathematical Physics (ICMP2015), held in Santiago, Chile, July 27-August 1, 2015. Several of the awardees also participated in the Young Researchers Symposium Held in Santiago, Chile, July 24 and 25, 2015. This Congress is organized every three years  by the International Association of Mathematical Physics since 1976.

Mathematical Physics is a field with a long tradition in Mathematics. Broadly defined consists on the applications of mathematics to problems in physics and the development of mathematical methods suitable for such applications and the formulations of physical theories. 

In conjunction with the exposure to state-of-the-art methods in Mathematical Physics ICMP2015 fostered the international collaboration between the US, Chile and Latin America and other countries in the world. It provided to the US participants an excellent opportunity to become integrated into the vibrant and interconnected mathematical physics community in the world. For many of the US scientists, especially junior ones, supported by the grant opened up an entirely new range of contacts and leading to new  projects and acitivities.  Participants in this Congress were able to exchange information about the latest advances in their research areas. 

The travel grant was instrumental in having a strong US presence in ICMP2015.
